title: Sources: Cowboys OL Smith gets $96M extension
content: The Dallas Cowboys have made left guard Tyler Smith the highest-paid interior offensive lineman in the NFL.

title: OU's Thomas tossed, faces suspension next week
content: Sooners sack leader R Mason Thomas was ejected for targeting from Saturday's game against Temple and will be suspended for the first half of next week's game against Auburn.

title: Sources: No urgency for Giants to start Dart
content: There is "no sense of urgency" in the Giants organization to bench Russell Wilson and start Jaxson Dart, sources told ESPN.

title: Texas RB Baxter injured on first play; ruled out
content: Texas running back CJ Baxter, the Longhorns' leading rusher, was injured on the first play of the game against UTEP and is not expected to return.

title: Simpson, Williams shine as Tide roll Wisconsin
content: Quarterback Ty Simpson threw for 382 yards and four touchdowns Saturday, including two to returning star receiver Ryan Williams as the 19th-ranked Tide overpowered Wisconsin 38-14 in Tuscaloosa.

title: Rizzo celebrated at Wrigley retirement ceremony
content: Nearly a decade after helping the Cubs to their first World Series title in 108 years, former first baseman Anthony Rizzo returned to Wrigley Field on Saturday to officially retire from playing while being appointed an ambassador to the team.

title: Source: Commanders RB Ekeler has torn Achilles
content: Commanders running back Austin Ekeler has suffered a torn right Achilles that will keep him out for the rest of the season, a source told ESPN.

title: üèÄ Report links Kawhi's late pay to Clips partner
content: A Clippers limited partner invested $1.99 million in Aspiration nine days before the company made an overdue $1.75 million payment to Kawhi Leonard, according to a report.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Jags trade RB Bigsby to Eagles for draft picks
content: The Jaguars have traded running back Tank Bigsby to the Eagles for 2026 fifth- and sixth-round picks.

content: Juventus are leading the Serie A clubs vying to bring in Joshua Zirkzee from Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: With nine months until the World Cup begins, which U.S. players are best positioned to make the squad after a turbulent September window?

content: The Tennessee Volunteers are sticking with their classically excellent combination of orange and white for a major SEC showdown with the Georgia Bulldogs.

content: The Steelers passer is one touchdown from tying the Packers legend at No. 4 in career passing TDs. One player opens up about both QBs.

title: Before Joe Flacco was the Browns QB, he was Baltimore's 'Joe Cool'
content: From the Ravens to the Browns, we have stories of how the QB is "ice cold when it comes to clutch situations."

content: The competitive eating legend was going to be joined at the giant glove by a contest-winning fan who competed with him.

title: Who wins the PLL championship? Key stats, matchups, X factors
content: The top two teams are set to clash on Sunday, with a title on the line. Here's everything you need to know.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Wireless Sets Reintroduced For Mata Vaishno Devi Route Security In J&K
content: The Mata Vaishno Devi Shrine Board (SMVDSB) will reintroduce wireless sets to strengthen the communication network along the track leading to the revered shrine, set to reopen on Sunday after a 19-day closure due to a landslide last month.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Water, Sanitation And Hygiene: What Latest Global Report Means For India
content: In the global development landscape, certain indices such as the Human Development Index (HDI) and the Global Hunger Index, garner considerable attention in India.

title: Man Gets 5-Year Jail Term For Sexually Assaulting Boy In Gurugram
content: A court in Gurugram sentenced a man to five years of imprisonment for sexually assaulting a boy three years ago, police said on Saturday.

title: Prohibition: Nitish Kumar's 2016 Gambit Now 2025 Bihar Polls Lightning Rod
content: In Bihar's politics, prohibition has always remained a controversial, deeply debated subject, and it is becoming increasingly so with the Assembly elections just months away.

title: Speech Therapist Sexually Assaults 6-Year-Old Girl In Delhi, Arrested
content: The incident was reported on September 7 when the child's mother raised suspicion after observing her daughter's unusual behaviour on returning from her therapy class in Delhi's Rohini.

title: Supreme Court Orders University Vice Chancellor To Note Harassment Case In Resume
content: It is advisable to forgive the wrongdoer but not to forget the wrongdoing, the Supreme Court has said while directing that its verdict with details of alleged sexual harassment by a vice-chancellor of a university be made part of his resume

title: Time To Address Issue Of Maternal Autonomy And Foetal Rights: Delhi High Court
content: It is time that lawmakers address the question of delineating the balance between maternal autonomy and foetal rights at the stage of viability, the Delhi High Court has observed.

title: Veep Secretariat Appoints Deputy Election Commissioner, Joint Secretary
content: Senior IAS officers Pawan Kumar Sharma and V Lalithalakshmi were on Saturday appointed as Deputy Election Commissioner and Joint Secretary in the Vice President's Secretariat, respectively, according to an official order.

title: Charlie Kirk Was Warned He Would Be "100% Killed" Before Utah Shooting
content: A top security expert had already warned Charlie Kirk that there was a '100% chance' he would be killed if necessary safety measures are not taken.

title: RG Kar Medical College Student Found Dead In Bengal's Malda, Mother Blames Lover
content: Mystery is shrouding the death of a tribal female medical student of state-run R.G. Kar Medical College and Hospital in Malda district of West Bengal.

title: Uttarakhand Man Hits Wife With Sickle, Strangles Her And Leaves Her Bleeding
content: Vishnu Chauhan, the accused, told police that he often had arguments with his wife. On Friday, he fought with her and, in a fit of rage, he hit her on the head with a sickle, before strangling her to death.

title: Ukraine Says It Needs $120 Billion To Fight Russia In 2026 If War Continues
content: Ukraine said Saturday that it needed at least $120 billion next year to fight Russia's invasion, and would need a similar amount to maintain its military, even if the war ended.

title: As Priyanka Gandhi Visits Wayanad, 2 Suicides Put Congress On Defensive
content: The alleged suicides of two party workers -one last year and another a day ago-in this hill district have put the opposition Congress in Kerala on the back foot. This is particularly damaging at a time when its MP, Priyanka Gandhi, is present there.

title: Woman, 3 Children Drown In Rivulet In Telangana: Cops
content: A woman and three children drowned in a rivulet in Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district of Telangana on Saturday, police said.

title: 16-Year-Old Girl Raped UP's Hardoi, 2 Arrested: Police
content: Two youths were arrested on Saturday for allegedly raping a 16-year-old girl on her birthday, police said.

title: Ukraine Hits One Of Russia's Largest Oil Refining Complexes
content: A Ukrainian drone crashed into one of Russia's largest oil refining complexes on Saturday, sparking a fire and causing minor damage, a Russian official said.

title: "Here To Serve People, Not Make Money,"' Says Actor Vijay
content: Actor-politician Vijay on Saturday night said that he entered politics only with the intention of serving the people and not for earning wealth.

title: Amid Seat-Sharing Troubles In Bihar, Tejashwi Yadav's 'All-243' Appeal
content: Amid a push from Mahagathbandhan allies for a larger share of seats for the Bihar Assembly elections, RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has made an appeal to the people of the state and said they should vote on all 243 seats in his name.

title: Kerala Man Who Fell Into Well, His Rescuer, Die After Rope Breaks: Cops
content: In a tragic incident, a man who fell into a well near Parippally here and the person who attempted to pull him out died on Saturday after the rope used in the rescue effort snapped, police said.

title: Woman Charged For Killing 5-Year-Old Daughter In Karnataka
content: A woman, along with her extramarital partner, has been charged for allegedly torturing and killing her 5-year-old daughter by dumping her alive in the Tungabhadra river in Ranebennur taluk, a police official said on Saturday.

title: What are the enhanced powers of Foreigners Tribunals? | Explainer
content: What do the Rules of the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025 specify? How many tribunals are operational in Assam? How have their roles changed? What is the order on Sri Lankan Tamils in India?‚Äù

title: Odisha Information Commission debars RTI applicant from filing applications for a year¬†
content: Observing that the applicant was seeking excess information, often repetitive, the Information Commissioner capped filing of number of applications at 12 in a calendar year for the applicant

title: S√©bastien Lecornu | Macron‚Äôs lieutenant
content: France‚Äôs President has chosen his long-time ally to lead the government and win the support of a fractious Parliament where no party has a majority

title: Educating young voters
content: Merely having a candidate to vote for is not enough. Maturity comes from understanding democracy as a dynamic system

title: PwD representation in Central workforce stuck around 1% for over a decade: DoPT data
content: RPwD Act, 2016 hiked PwD quota to 4%, but less than 1.2% of Central government employees are disabled; DoPT data does not clarify whether all these PwD employees were hired for reserved posts only

title: Maratha community at par in education, says petitioner challenging SEBC reservation
content: A petitioner says Maratha community is ‚Äúnot backward‚Äù or ‚Äúeconomically capable‚Äù during Bombay High Court hearing on SEBC Act validity

title: Tamil Nadu yet to implement expanded AB PM-JAY for people over 70 years
content: As of now, differences of opinion between the Union government and the Tamil Nadu government with regard to the implementation have not been resolved

title: New tourism circuits being developed in Rajasthan to promote desert, tribal tourism
content: Rajasthan Deputy CM Diya Kumari said new policies were being implemented to promote concert tourism, destination weddings and meetings, incentives, conferences and exhibitions tourism in the State

title: Decisions in national, public interest define our culture: U.P. CM Yogi Adityanath
content: The State Chief Minister emphasises progress and innovation in healthcare at RMLIMS foundation day ceremony

title: Tamil Nadu produces the most number of engineers in the country, says Deputy CM
content: Crediting former Chief Minister Kalaignar M. Karunanidhi for the surge in engineering colleges in T.N., Udhayanidhi Stalin says engineers from the State are spread across the globe

title: Actor Vijay begins State-wide political tour with massive rally in Tiruchi
content: Accusing the BJP and DMK of ‚Äòbetraying‚Äô and ‚Äòtormenting‚Äô the people, he declares that the TVK‚Äôs objective was to free Tamil Nadu of poverty, nepotism, and corruption and usher in a true and conscientious democracy

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. to present ‚ÄòSwachha Andhra Awards‚Äô
content: Modelled on Swachh Survekshan Awards, the aim is to raise the bar on maintenance of cleanliness and sanitation, says Swachha Andhra Corporation Chairman Pattabhi Ram

title: NDA‚Äôs worker conference turns into battlefield in Bihar
content: Supporters of cabinet minister Sumit Kumar Singh and former MLC Sanjay Prasad clashed with each other in the presence of Union minister Ramnath Thakur and the other senior leaders of the NDA.¬†

title: ‚ÄòIllegal‚Äô houses of two rape accused razed in M.P. under security
content: Bhopal Collector Kaushalendra Vikram Singh told The Hindu that the houses were built on illegally encroached government land and that the families of the two men were living there on rent.¬†

title: AAP-BJP spar over financial aid for Punjab flood victims
content: Punjab BJP president accused the AAP government of not utilising the State Disaster Relief Fund, demanding Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann to apologise to the people of Punjab

title: Push for Bharat Ratna for Kuvempu puts focus on his value system
content: The Congress government‚Äôs recent move to recommend to the Union government to confer the Bharat Ratna posthumously on Kuvempu, a towering personality of Kannada literature, puts the focus not just on his works but also his emphasis on rationality and human values

title: Manipur‚Äôs displaced people meet PM Modi, seek safe passage to home, jobs
content: Living in relief camps ever since the ethnic violence broke out in the State in 2023, the people, who met the Prime Minister amid heavy security, urge Narendra Modi to restore their livelihoods and ensure free movement through National Highway-2

title: 'Salami slicing': Russia's incursion into Poland - How Putin has riled Trump, again
content: Following a Russian drone incursion into Polish airspace, NATO scrambled jets, raising alarms across Europe. Trump's initial ambiguous response, downplaying the incident, unsettled allies who view Poland's security as vital to NATO's credibility. This event highlights concerns about Trump's commitment to defending NATO allies and his perceived hesitation in confronting Russian aggression, potentially emboldening further provocations.

title: Manipur visit: PM Modi calls state 'jewel in India's crown'; seeks peace between hills, valley
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Manipur, appealing for harmony amidst ethnic strife. He unveiled ‚Çπ8,500 crore in projects to rebuild infrastructure and restore hope, emphasizing reconciliation and development. Modi met displaced families, reaffirming the government's commitment to peace.

title: In Nato letter, Trump calls out 'shocking' Russian oil buys ‚Äî why it matters to India
content: Donald Trump's open letter to NATO, urging a halt to Russian oil imports, notably omits India, despite past criticisms. This omission indirectly supports India's argument about Western double standards, as New Delhi has long pointed out Europe's continued reliance on Russian energy while facing scrutiny. Trump's focus on European purchases validates India's defense.

title: Politics heats up over India-Pak match: Oppn corners govt, BJP cites 'compulsion'
content: The upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash ignites political controversy. Shiv Sena (UBT) and Congress leaders criticize the match as immoral and profit-driven, citing past grievances and questioning the government's stance. BJP leaders, however, rally behind the Indian team, framing it as a matter of national pride. Maharashtra leaders exchange barbs, highlighting the deep divisions surrounding the event.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: IND vs PAK boycott: Ex-cricketer and BJP leader reiterates - ‚ÄòShouldn‚Äôt be played‚Äô
content: Following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, calls to boycott India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan intensify. Kedar Jadhav reiterates his stance against the match, echoing strong public sentiment. While the Indian team acknowledges the sensitivity, they remain focused on cricket, guided by government and BCCI instructions, as emphasized by fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate.

title: Nepal president announces polls: Himalyan nation to elect govt in March
content: Nepal's President dissolved parliament, prompting condemnation from major political parties amidst a backdrop of recent deadly protests and political upheaval. Fresh elections are scheduled for next March, while the newly appointed Prime Minister Karki seeks cooperation to ensure timely polls. Despite political tensions, normalcy is gradually returning to Kathmandu as the nation grapples with the aftermath of widespread unrest.

title: Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing: Musk questions Microsoft over staff's remarks; company responds
content: Elon Musk has called out Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella over alleged posts by Activision Blizzard employees celebrating Charlie Kirk's assassination. Screenshots of these posts circulated on X, prompting Musk to question Nadella directly. Microsoft responded, stating they are reviewing the situation and condemning any comments celebrating violence, emphasizing that such views do not align with the company's values.

title: 'Violation of women's dignity': FIR against Cong leaders over AI clip of PM's mother
content: An FIR has been filed in Delhi against Congress leaders following the circulation of an AI-generated video featuring Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his late mother. The video, shared by the Bihar Congress, has been described as defamatory and insulting. BJP leaders have strongly condemned the video, while Congress defends it as not disrespectful, sparking a political controversy.

title: Asia Cup: Big blow to India ahead of Pakistan game! Star batter hit on the hands
content: India faced a scare ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against Pakistan as Shubman Gill was struck on the hand during practice, causing visible discomfort. The team physio attended to him, and his condition is being closely monitored. This setback occurs just before the highly anticipated clash, adding pressure to India's preparations.

title: Will Joe Burrow play against the Jacksonville Jaguars tomorrow?
content: Cincinnati Bengals' quarterback Joe Burrow is set to play against the Jacksonville Jaguars at Paycor Stadium. After a victorious season opener against the Cleveland Browns, Burrow expressed his readiness to be more aggressive and adaptable on the field. Despite some Bengals players listed with injuries, Burrow is reported to be fully fit and focused on securing another win.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Richardson vs Jackson: 100m heat thriller at World Championships
content: Sha'Carri Richardson edged out Shericka Jackson in a thrilling 100m heat at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, clocking 11.03 seconds. Jackson finished a close second at 11.04 seconds. Australia's Torrie Lewis secured third place with 11.08 seconds, setting a new national record. This victory fuels Richardson's confidence as she prepares for the semi-finals, continuing her rivalry with Jackson.

title: SC dismisses NUJS's sexual harassment complaint; orders VC to mention judgment in resume
content: The Supreme Court dismissed a sexual harassment complaint against the NUJS Vice-Chancellor, citing a delay in filing beyond the POSH Act's limitation period. While the court acknowledged the delayed complaint, it directed that the judgment be included in the Vice-Chancellor's resume. This unusual directive serves as a permanent record of the allegations, despite their dismissal on procedural grounds.

title: ‚ÄòThat wasn‚Äôt even a moment‚Äô: Fans slam NFL over Charlie Kirk tribute; sparks outrage
content: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Utah tragedy: Patrick Mahomes silent after Kirk shooting; Randi, Tavia speak out
content: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: Sanford International round: John Daly makes history; shocking 19 on 12th hole
content: Golf icon John Daly made unwanted history at the Sanford International, carding a shocking 19 on the par-5 12th hole. This score is now the highest ever recorded on a single hole in Champions Tour history. Daly's troubles began with a wayward tee shot, and lead to seven penalty drops.

title: Corey Perry sidelined after knee surgery, out 6-8 weeks for Los Angeles Kings
content: Veteran forward Corey Perry's debut with the Los Angeles Kings is delayed due to a knee injury sustained during training. The 40-year-old, signed in July, will be sidelined for 6-8 weeks, potentially missing October, including the home opener against Colorado. The Kings remain optimistic about Perry's return, valuing his experience and scoring ability for a deep playoff run.

title: Davis Cup: Epic! India defeat Switzerland for a rare milestone since 1993
content: India have made it to the Davis Cup Qualifiers. Sumit Nagal's win over Henry Bernet sealed the victory against Switzerland. This is India's first away win against a European team since 1993. Nagal's return to the Davis Cup proved crucial. Earlier, N Sriram Balaji and Rithvik Bollipalli lost the doubles match. The Davis Cup Qualifiers are scheduled for January 2026.

title: India vs Pakistan: Zayed Khan backs Team India ahead of Asia Cup 2025 clash
content: Bollywood actor Zayed Khan has come out in full support of Team India before their high-voltage Asia Cup 2025 clash against Pakistan. Confident about the Men in Blue‚Äôs form, Zayed declared that India will dominate the tournament, calling them a ‚Äúdamn good team.‚Äù

title: New study warns fish oil supplements linked to heart disease; raises high risks
content: Recent research from the British Heart Foundation suggests regular fish oil supplements may slightly elevate stroke and atrial fibrillation risk in healthy individuals. Conversely, those with existing heart conditions might experience reduced heart attack risk and improved survival. Experts recommend obtaining omega-3s through diet, emphasizing oily fish, nuts, and seeds.

title: ‚Äò50‚Äì100% tariff‚Äô: Trump threatens China; presses Nato to unite on Russia sanctions
content: Donald Trump has proposed significant tariffs on Chinese goods and urged NATO allies to cease oil purchases from Russia to swiftly end the war in Ukraine. He criticized NATO's commitment and blamed Biden and Zelenskyy for prolonging the conflict.

title: Are you experiencing 'tall poppy syndrome'? Subtle workplace signs to notice
content: Tall Poppy Syndrome, prevalent globally but originating in Australia and New Zealand, describes the phenomenon of high achievers being subtly undermined in workplaces. A study reveals this affects women disproportionately, impacting confidence and mental health. This manifests as exclusion, downplaying ambition, and reluctance to showcase creative work, hindering both individual growth and organizational innovation.

title: China gold licences: Yellow metal‚Äôs largest buyer to ease rules; diversify from dollar
content: China is easing gold import/export licensing, aiming to diversify reserves from the US dollar. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) plans to broaden the use of faster ‚Äúmulti-use permits‚Äù by increasing authorized ports and extending permit validity. This builds on a 2016 initiative to streamline gold trade.

title: Fact check: Does putting a claw clip on the eyebrow really help with migraines?
content: A viral social media trend suggests using claw clips on eyebrows to alleviate migraines, garnering millions of views. While some users report relief, Dr. Suzanne Wylie expresses skepticism, citing a lack of scientific evidence. Neurologist Soniya Tambe Jinde explains the potential benefit through the Gate Control Theory of Pain, where pressure may reduce pain signals reaching the brain. Read below!

title: Asia Cup: India coach reacts to Pakistan match boycott talks - 'Players are aware'
content: Amidst strong calls for boycott following the Pahalgam terror attack, India's cricket team support staff has addressed the sensitive issue before the Asia Cup clash against Pakistan. While acknowledging public sentiment, the team management, led by Gautam Gambhir's message to focus on cricket, emphasized adherence to BCCI and government directives, prioritizing the game while respecting the authorities' decisions.

title: 'Who cares?': Channing Frye targets Pablo Torre ‚Äî Clippers report heat
content: The NBA is investigating the Los Angeles Clippers for alleged salary cap circumvention related to Kawhi Leonard's compensation. Investigative journalist Pablo Torre reported the allegations, sparking reactions from figures like Channing Frye, who initially criticized Torre before walking back his comments. Torre has since responded to Frye's remarks, as the league's investigation continues, with more details expected to emerge.

title: 'Connected by shared history': PM Modi's message to Nepal; lauds Sushila Karki
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his visit to Manipur, extended congratulations to Sushila Karki on becoming Nepal's first woman Prime Minister, reaffirming India's strong ties with Nepal. He lauded Nepal's democratic values and the resilience of its people. Modi also addressed the Manipur crisis, assuring support and urging peace for progress in the region.

title: Waqf Amendment Act: SC to deliver interim order Monday; ‚Äòwaqf by user‚Äô in focus
content: The Supreme Court is set to deliver its interim order on Monday regarding petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025's constitutional validity. These petitions, including one from Asaduddin Owaisi, question the inclusion of non-Muslims in Waqf boards and the recognition of "waqf by user" properties.

title: Asia Cup: IND vs PAK to be boycotted? Widow after Pahalgam attack blasts BCCI
content: Aishanya Dwivedi, widow of a victim in the Pahalgam terror attack, has passionately appealed for a boycott of the upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, criticising the BCCI's decision and the silence of Indian cricketers. She questions the sponsors and broadcasters, urging fans to abstain from watching the game, fearing revenue will fund terrorism.

title: 'Everything gets harder': Arshdeep after benched vs UAE; post goes viral
content: Ahead of the crucial Asia Cup clash against Pakistan, Arshdeep Singh's cryptic Instagram post sparked speculation about his mindset after being benched. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak defended the team selection, emphasizing that decisions are based on conditions and team balance. As India prepares to face Pakistan, the possibility of including a second pacer looms, leaving Arshdeep's potential inclusion uncertain.

title: ‚ÄòDemanded job again‚Äô: Fired worker kills Hyderabad bizman in full public view; manhunt on
content: In Hyderabad, real estate businessman Srikanth Reddy was fatally stabbed in Moulali's HB Colony on Friday. The primary suspect, Dhanraj, a former employee fired for intoxication, repeatedly sought re-employment. After receiving money for liquor, Dhanraj, along with an accomplice Daniel, returned and attacked Srikanth when his job request was denied.

title: Saquon Barkley vs Chiefs: Bold warning to defense ‚Äî Super Bowl rematch set
content: Saquon Barkley fired back at the Kansas City Chiefs ahead of the Philadelphia Eagles‚Äô Super Bowl LIX rematch. After being shut down in February, the star running back warned Kansas City‚Äôs defense that if they fail to stack the box, he will punish them. Barkley looks to bounce back as Philadelphia visits Arrowhead Stadium on Sept. 14.

title: 'Just say when': Donald Trump pleads Nato nations to sanction Russia
content: Donald Trump stated his willingness to impose significant sanctions on Russia, contingent on all NATO nations ceasing Russian oil imports and implementing similar measures. He criticized some NATO members for continuing energy purchases from Russia, deeming it detrimental to the alliance's negotiating strength. Trump also suggested imposing substantial tariffs on China until the Ukraine war concludes.

title: Delhi's Bhai Dooj gift: Pink Card registration begins from Oct; free bus travel for women
content: The Delhi government is gearing up to launch its Pink Card initiative by mid-October, offering women lifetime free bus travel as a Bhai Dooj gift. Registration for the 'Saheli Smart Card' will be online, requiring KYC verification through selected banks.

title: 'Kohli isn't there': Ex-Pakistan captain warns India
content: Former Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq believes Pakistan has a golden opportunity in the upcoming Asia Cup clash against India. He suggests Virat Kohli's absence makes India's batting line-up vulnerable if Pakistan's bowlers strike early. India's recent Asia Cup opener saw a dominant win against UAE, fueled by Kuldeep Yadav's spell and quickfire batting.

title: ‚ÄòImage must change‚Äô: Tharoor says India seen unsafe for women; flags tourism inequality
content: Shashi Tharoor urges India to prioritize women's safety for tourism growth. He highlights tourism's potential to combat unemployment and generate revenue. Tharoor criticizes the lack of mid-range tourist facilities. He emphasizes the need for more hotels and improved infrastructure. He notes that India attracts fewer tourists than smaller destinations. Tharoor calls for giving tourism greater priority.

title: Asia Cup: Shoaib Akhtar's brutal India vs Pakistan prediction - 'Hammer you down'
content: India and Pakistan are set to clash in a highly anticipated Asia Cup match in Dubai, following dominant wins in their opening games. Shoaib Akhtar predicts India will aim to dominate Pakistan, emphasizing the need for Pakistan to perform at their peak. The match promises to be an exciting chapter in the storied rivalry.

title: New Railway line brings new hope for Mizoram‚Äôs handicrafts
content: The opening of the 51.38-km Bairabi‚ÄìSairang broad-gauge railway line, constructed by Indian Railways, is being hailed as a turning point for Mizoram by residents.

title: Watch | PM Modi in Manipur: Ethnic violence victims request a safe return back to home
content: Ethnic violence victims in Manipur appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit, urging support to ensure their safe return home as peace and development initiatives take shape in the state

title: Adani Power to invest $3 billion to set up 2400 MW power project in Bihar
content: The Adani group company, in a statement, said that it has signed a 25-year Power Supply Agreement (PSA) with Bihar State Power Generation Company Ltd. (BSPGCL) to supply power from the project that will come up at Pirpainti in Bhagalpur district of the state

title: PM Modi congratulates Sushila Karki, Nepal‚Äôs first woman PM
content: Addressing a gathering in Manipur, Mr. Modi expresses confidence that Ms. Karki will pave the way for peace and stability in the neighbouring country

title: After 40-year court battle with State, SC restores Constituent Assembly member‚Äôs historic estates to his charitable trust
content: The order would act as a precedent against the government interfering in or caveating private wills without first proving intestacy, and a complete absence of heirs

title: Let Revanth Reddy make 10 defected MLAs quit and re-contest, if he has faith in his work: KTR
content: BRS working president flays Gadwal MLA Krishna Mohan Reddy for his ‚Äúneither here nor there condition‚Äù

title: One more Maoist killed by security forces in Bijapur operation
content: After two Maoists had been killed on Friday, another body was recovered today under the same operation, Bijapur SP Jitendra Kumar Yadav said

title: BJP seeks Governor‚Äôs intervention in Malayalam university ‚Äòland fraud‚Äô

title: Revanth asserts Telangana‚Äôs claim over 904 TMC ft Krishna waters
content: For decades, Telangana suffered injustice in Krishna allocations. This is our opportunity to rectify the wrongs and secure every drop due to us, the Chief Minister told officials

title: Singareni to deploy women operators in opencast mines soon¬†
content: Those who are working as general assistants, badli workers to get the opportunity as SCCL plans to utilise in-house human resources first

title: Pune techie attacked with billhook outside Vimannagar; accused arrested
content: In Pune, a 33-year-old IT professional was brutally attacked with a billhook outside his fianc√©e's workplace in Vimannagar. Two men, later arrested, assaulted him due to mistaken identity, fueled by a cab driver's suspicion of a love affair. The victim sustained severe injuries, prompting calls for increased security and patrolling in the area, highlighting rising concerns about criminal activities.

title: ITR filing: Over 6 cr returns submitted so far; Sept 15 deadline looms for taxpayers
content: The Income Tax Department announced it has received over six crore income tax returns for the Assessment Year 2025-26. The deadline for filing without penalty is September 15th. The department's helpdesk is available 24/7 to assist taxpayers. An extension was granted due to revisions in ITR forms. ITR submissions have been steadily increasing, with a record 7.

title: KFRI to host global workshop on forest landscape restoration from September 14¬†
content: International experts and local scientists to converge to turn cutting-edge research into actionable strategies for restoring forest ecosystems

title: Jagan misleading public on Pulivendula Medical College works, alleges MLC Ramagopal Reddy
content: Most of the civil work remains incomplete, and buildings meant for students‚Äô hostels and staff quarters are nowhere in sight, he asserts

title: Gujarat government‚Äôs nutrition scheme provides meals to 40 lakh students
content: The programme provides primary school students snacks everyday that contain approximately 200 kilocalories and 6 grams of protein per serving

title: As long as I am with people, my age and gender hardly matter, says Colombo Mayor

title: News: Tigers' Tarik Skubal exits start early with tightness in side
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the first of six matinees is at Wrigley Field with the Chicago Cubs hosting the Tampa Bay Rays . ace Tarik Skubal leaves in the fourth inning with an apparent injury .

title: Falcons bench kicker Koo after missed FG vs. Bucs
content: younghoe Koo has been benched to out for the game against the Buccaneers . he missed a 44-yard field goal last week that would have tied the Falcons' game at 23 . Koo missed nine field goals last year, making just 73.5% .

title: Vikings' classic uniforms, Bengals' orange tops NFL Week 2 threads
content: the Vikings will be the first team to rock throwback uniforms in week 2 of the new season . the look borrows design elements from some of the earliest uniforms with a deeper purple than the modern version . for the second straight season, the Cincinnati Bengals are rocking orange jerseys .

title: After season of adversity, can Liberty put together another title run?
content: the 19-point win made them the ninth team in WNBA history to start a season 9-0 . only the top four seeds get home-court advantage in the best-of-three opening series . the Liberty finished fifth in the 2025 championship .

title: 'He threw the freakin' shoe!': Revisiting Marco Wilson's infamous toss five years later
content: college football's Marco Wilson throws an LSU player's shoe in the fourth quarter of a rivalry game on Dec. 12, 2020 . the throw, which came in a tie game against a heavy underdog, certainly cost Florida a win . five years later, the play proved a turning point in the history of an once-proud Florida program .

title: La Ni√±a likely by year-end, may bring colder winter in India: Experts
content: Neha Madaan is a senior feature writer at The Times of India, Pune. She holds an M A degree in Mass Communication and Journalism from University of Pune. She covers tourism, heritage development and its conservation, apart from an array of subjects such as civic issues, environment, astronomy, civic school education as well as social issues concerning persons with disabilities. Her interests include metaphysical research and animal rights.
